quote_a: But I also try to have it generate a weekly meal plan for me, just to help take off some of the mental load of having to think about dinner all the time. I must say that it didn't really help me much.
quote_b: if my personal assistant could make sure that I have food in the home every night with a healthy, easy-to-cook meal, that would be great. I don't want to have to think about it or fall back on maybe ordering a pizza every week. I just want the assistant to decide for me so I can eat something healthy without the effort.
explanation: She reports that AI meal planning did not help her, yet her ideal assistant is still built around the same meal-decision automation that has already failed her.

quote_a: I would need to feed it so much information, like my calendar, and I didn't want to do that. It also doesn't proactively give me hints, so that didn't work.
quote_b: If the AI were connected to my calendar, it would help me plan and think about when might be a good time for things. Of course, I would need to keep everything in my calendar, which I don't do at the moment.
explanation: She declined to share calendar data with AI because she did not want to, yet later describes calendar integration as the key enabler of her ideal assistant â€” while also admitting she does not maintain her calendar.
